name: Hotel Maria Cristina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there with my husband for a few nights around Christmas time. We got a deluxe room with king size bed. The room was spacious with a good sized and very clean bathroom. Our only complaint was the air conditioning. The deluxe room is equipped with a/c (which you pay the extra $20 US for). Unfortunately, our air did not function correctly and we had to call reception several times before moving to a different room. Once we moved everything seemed to work fine.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good price

reviews.text: A week later, on the last leg of our trip before heading home, we tried our luck in a standard room. This was great (and cheaper). It was a bit smaller with a smaller bathroom, but all in all a very nice room.
reviews.title: Good Memories of The Maria Cristina

reviews.text: If you are looking for a luxury hotel, I would stay somewhere else, and pay a premium. If you are looking for a clean & spacious room in a great location, I would book the Maria Cristina.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.liked: — it was very clean and the staff was very friendly

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times. Admittedly I haven't been there in the last ten years but your reviewers seem to confirm what I remember. Also friends who have been staying there for years and have done so recently agree with my memory. I have traveled the world extensively and even though I have stayed at some very grand and quite famous hotels I will be staying at this hotel when I go to Mexico City later this year.
reviews.title: Great find in Mexico City!!!

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful especially the front desk. The rooms have always been satisfactory. While I do not recall the menu at the restaurant being very innovative I have always enjoyed my meals there.
reviews.title: Great choice

likes.liked: — Spaciousness of room and the pretty grounds
likes.disliked: — Would have liked the subway to be slightly closer

reviews.title: A Gem with Character
reviews.text: I know Mexico City well, and when I was a kid in the 70's there used to be many hotels like the Maria Cristina...privately owned, well run, clean and, even though they weren't swanky or had tons of amenities, they were inviting and charming. If you'd prefer a soulless, overpriced business hotel that feels like Denver or Kyoto or Frankfurt, don't stay here; you don't deserve it. The Maria Cristina is a charming, well run, respectable hotel with a solid staff who have seen it all. The rooms are quite, cleaning ladies efficient, the restaurant a deal and all for WAY below what you'll pay at the Fiesta American or Sheraton...all in a great location. I'd rather you NOT know about this place, but I want to make sure they stick around for awhile and compete with the big guys around the block. If you're a seasoned traveler, you'll understand once you're there.

What a nice place to stay. Clean and convenience location hotel. It was so comfortable to stay Maria Christina. It's quite enough and also walking distance to Zona Rosa. My favourite place was Bar. It was such a nice place to drink beer and take a rest. Restaurant was not good. I recommend to go to any taco stand near by. If I go to Mexico City again, I will stay there. Because it's very clean, safe, nice, good service and beautiful colonial style hotel which you can not find in the U.S.
reviews.title: My home in Mexico City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 26OCT-29OCT2006
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and everything was perfect. Very comfortable rooms, well-equiped bathrooms, very quiet despite being close to the Reforma. Friendly staff and a beautiful colonial house....if you want to stay in Mexico City without paying the overpriced international chain-hotels, this is the ideal place.
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.disliked: — front desk, but probable my lack of spanish

reviews.title: Good value, but watch out for bait-and-switch
reviews.text: totally agree..our experience was good. The Maria Cristina is a great hotel for the casual or the business traveler. This 'classic choice for budget travelers' It was a very individual hotel, with a classic lobby, uniformed staff. Nice breakfast at restuarant & friendly waiters. We had a deluxe double standard room overlooking the garden. Very clean and nice linens. Very quiet. AC, windows opened & fan. We are non-smokers, not sure if they have non smoking rooms, but didn't smell.

reviews.title: Great Staff, Excellent Restaurants, Pleasant Rooms
reviews.text: ROOMS: Tried the single the first night. It was a tight fit and lacked air conditioning, but was adequate. Upgraded to a Deluxe Double thereafter that was quite spacious, clean and had a pleasant view of the courtyard.

STAFF: Receptionists went, in my opinion, beyond the normal call of duty to help me and other guests with information...maps, phone numbers, itinerary information, etc. The restaurant staff was interminably patient despite "energetic" children dining. I also found the recommended doctor...Dr. Mora... very helpful when I was in need of services.
reviews.title: Ok but a bit overrated

reviews.text: RESTAURANT: Excellent variety, including calamar. Always pleased w/ the multiple meals I ate here. And I appreciated efforts to segragate smokers from non-smokers.
reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment

reviews.text: ANCILLARY: Nice little shop offered essentials and postcards. Also, 3 Internet computers available 24x7, rather inexpensive and I never had to wait for one. Very attractive courtyard.
reviews.title: We loved the Marie Cristina

likes.liked: — The rooms were clean and well kept.
likes.disliked: — We didn't get the rooms we booked so we had no air conditioning.

reviews.text: LOCATION: OXXO selling Mazapan just two blocks away!!!!! :-) Very close to El Angel. Chapultepec w/in walking distance, but I took a taxi. Seemed to be a safe area, I never felt nervous day or night walking near the hotel.
reviews.title: Maria Cristina

reviews.text: I came to the hotel with doubts, as it wasn´t in Zocalo area neather Polanco area. The reality is that is in between this two areas and near Condesa. You can not expect a five star facilities, but for the money that you pay is excelent. The hotel is a block from reforma on the other side of reforma from the Zona Rosa. It is an oasis of calm a tranquility in this big city. The garden is a place to relax and rest.
reviews.title: Excellente choice, value and locationf for money

reviews.text: I was very happy with my stay. The room for one is around 66 dolars and 74 for two. But be advise that are better room with A/C form 85 dolars.
reviews.title: An Oasis in the middle of the city, great location, and excelent value

reviews.text: I would recomend this hotel for anyone that wants to try some thing different from big brands and do not want to spent over 100 dolars for two people.
reviews.title: Getting tired of it

reviews.text: I have stay in this hotel many times, during the years.
reviews.title: Just Lovely...

reviews.text: This past years, it has been some investment and improvements in the hotel in order to try to achieve a higher level of quiality.
reviews.title: Great location and nice style

description: The Hotel Maria Cristina is located in the most important Financial Center in Mexico City, near the best entertainment places. Enjoy comfort and top service in one of our 150 guest rooms with internet service (WIFI)and convenient hotel amenities such as restaurant-bar, beauty salon, souvenir shop, a business center and function space for meetings or special events and the hotel has a beautiful garden.
